subject: Medicine
title: The Cerebral Cortex
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Cerebral Cortex.

hook.text: Unfolded, your cerebral cortex would cover a large pizza. All that surface area fits inside your skull in folds.

buildup.text: The cortex is the wrinkled outer layer of the brain, divided into four lobes with specialized functions.

discovery.text: The frontal lobe handles planning and personality. The occipital lobe processes vision. Each region has a role.

twist.text: Humans don't have the biggest brains, but we have the most cortex relative to body sizeâ€”that's our edge.

climax.text: The cortex enables language, abstract thought, and planningâ€”the abilities that define human intelligence.

quiz.question: What gives humans their cognitive advantage?
options: The most cerebral cortex relative to body size
Having the largest brain of any animal
Having more neurons than any other species
